title: Police: Suspect in Enterprise shooting that injured 4 taken into custody
content:
ENTERPRISE, AL (WSFA) -
The suspect involved in a shooting at a house party over the weekend, that left multiple people injured, has been arrested, according to the Enterprise Police Department.
Police say 22-year-old Devonquez Kelon Blackmon was arrested around 12:30 a.m. on Thursday after authorities received information from the public that Blackmon was in Geneva County.
Blackmon was reportedly taken into custody without incident in Geneva County with the assistance of the Geneva County Sheriff's Office, Alabama State Troopers and Alabama Game Wardens. He is charged with second degree assault.
According to police, Blackmon's arrest stems from an incident in which four people were shot at a house party on Baxter Street in Enterprise on Saturday.
Police say the preliminary investigation revealed that a verbal and physical altercation preceded the shooting in which numerous shots were fired outside the residence.
The four individuals who were shot were transported to the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries by ambulance and personal vehicle.
Police also say that numerous personal items have been recovered following the shooting. Items include jewelry, clothing and other things. Police are asking any individuals who lost personal items on the night of the shooting to contact the Enterprise Police Department's Criminal Investigations Division at 334-347-2222.
